discussion.content:
Correct answer is :
Azure AD Premium Plan 2 (This will make sure you get Access Review feature as well as MAU billing. With P1 you wont get Access Review but can get MAU billing. )
An Azure AD tenant must be linked to a resource group within an Azure subscription for proper billing and access to MAU features.

Access Review is an Azure AD Premium plan 2 feature, so I would say Azure AD Premium plan 2 answer : https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/governance/access-reviews-overview#license-requirements

Regarding second one, I agree link Azure subscription : https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/external-identities/external-identities-pricing

comments.content: Depends which e5 you are looking at. office 365 e5 is different than microsoft 365 e5. (m365 has azure ad premium p2 whereas o365 e5 doesnot).

For me if you should on and off now correct is „Users can opt in”

discussion.content: Teams > teams update policies > add > Show teams preview features
O exame MS-700 contém laboratórios de simulação como este?

comments.content: sorry did not click "reveal the solution" instead did research myself first

discussion.content:
I believe the simulation question is How to provide access only to a specific user who can turn on and off Teams preview features form their Teams desktop client?

Solution : Create a custom Teams Update policy with "allow public feature preview" enabled & then assign that custom policy to a User Account in this case Adele.
----------------------------------
Step 1:TAC>Teams>Teams update Policies>Create a new policy and enable "Allow Public preview". 
Step 2: Apply the update policy to user Adele.

reference :https://office365itpros.com/2020/11/30/teams-preview-features/

The user can then Switch to the Teams public preview from their client https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/get-early-access-to-new-teams-features-a6e387fe-1cad-4f90-ad78-1a311c77b36d
where is simulation came from? making thing more complex

comments.content: The answer provided by nwmc is correct.
Do you had this question in a real exam situation? Maybe you have no access to the TAC, but only the Teams Client. If you have access to the TAC, I would agree with you.

The question states "To complete this task, sign in to the Microsoft 365 portal"

discussion.content: The Answer is wrong. you should do this in TAC > Teams Settings>Files> all options turn off

comments.content:
Confusing as detail is light in the question. This must be the answer now then:
Microsoft Teams supports storing and sharing files on a number of 3rd party providers, including Citrix files, DropBox, Box, Google Drive and Egnyte. You wish to restrict file storage to Sharepoint and OneDrive for Business only, so you will disable all 3rd party providers.
Microsoft Teams Admin Center, select Org-wide settings > Teams Settings
Under Files, starting with Citrix files and continuing downward to Egnyte set all of the toggles to Off.
Scroll down to click the Save button.

I agree with unbelievable's answer above as the question is specifically on how to set SharePoint as default storage for all Teams, but the solution provided when you reveal the solution only applies to only one Team and not all.

discussion.content:
1. Log in to the Microsoft 365 admin center using your admin credentials.
2. In the left-hand navigation, click on "Settings" and then click on "Services & add-ins".
3. Select "Microsoft Teams" from the list of services.
4. Under "SharePoint storage", click on "Edit".
5. In the "SharePoint storage" section, select "SharePoint" as the default storage option.
6. To disable the other storage options, look for "Allow access to other storage providers" and uncheck it.
7. Click on "Save" to apply the changes.

1. Sign in to the admin center.
2. Go to the Settings > Org settings page.
3. On the Services tab, select Microsoft 365 on the web.
4. Select or clear the checkbox to let users open files stored in third-party storage services in Microsoft 365 on the web, and then select Save.

From https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/setup/set-up-file-storage-and-sharing?view=o365-worldwide#enable-or-disable-third-party-storage-services

With Office on the Web changing over to Microsoft 365 on the web, it appears that Rider79's answer is the most correct, if you're trying to restrict this storage from the M365 admin center alone. If you have access to TAC, then nwmc has the best answer.

comments.content: You're in a simulated environment, but yes.

discussion.content: During test, you need to type MS365 portal URL?

Wrong answer, 
It should be TAC > Teams Settings > Files > Set All Options to Off
so user within the tenant can only save their files in SharePoint.

1- Sign in to to the admin center.
2 - Go to the Settings > Org settings page.
3 - On the Services tab, select Office on the web.
4 - Select or deselect the check box to turn third-party storage on or off, then select Save changes.
Source: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/setup/set-up-file-storage-and-sharing?view=o365-worldwide
